titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the A.M. Byers Company Personnel Records, 1905-1960 AIS.1974.31
titlestmt.author: Zachary Brodt.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:14:38 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A.M. Byers Company was a steel and wrought iron pipe manufacturer founded in 1863. This collection contains personnel cards detailing work histories of employees of the A.M. Byers Company plants in South Side Pittsburgh and Ambridge, Pennsylvania.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mr. Aaron Mandel, President of Domes, Inc., in 1974.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: A.M. Byers Company was a steel and wrought iron pipe manufacturer with plants in South Side Pittsburgh and Ambridge, Pennsylvania. The company was founded in 1863 and the Pittsburgh plants were closed in 1969 prior to the company's acquisition by the General Tire and Rubber Company.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.p: A.M. Byers Company Personnel Records, 1905-1960, AIS.1974.31, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Zachary Brodt, Amy Brunner, Kimberley Elliott, Alexandra Hebda, Thaddeus J. Kotarski III, Emma Mosser, Antonio Parente.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection, primarily comprising personnel cards, contains work histories of employees of the A.M. Byers Company. Included in the histories are the worker's name, wage rate, occupation, date of hire, length of time on the job, and reasons for leaving. Demographic information, such as date of birth, gender, marital status, race, ethnicity, place of birth, citizenship, and English language ability are also present. These histories are arranged by the workers last name. Publications from the Metallurgy Department are also included.

controlaccess.subject: Steel pipe industry -- Pennsylvania -- Pittsburgh
Iron and steel workers -- Pennsylvania -- Pittsburgh
Labor
Business and Industry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes the employee records of white employees at the South Side Pittsburgh and Ambridge plants. Also included are a small group of records concerning employees of Middle Eastern or Asian descent.

did.unittitle: Employee Records, MIHALIC, M-MILLER, JOHN J

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes the employee records of African American employees at the South Side Pittsburgh and Ambridge plants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes publications and catalogs from the Metallurgy Departmental library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This material was added to the finding aid in December 2010.
